relation: The name of a URL parameter
Default value in case parameter is empty or missing
Convert newlines in textarea to other delimiters
Encode special characters into HTML entities, like a double quote into ". This is needed if text is put into an HTML form field
Encode special characters for URL parameter use, like a double quote into %22
If set, gets all selected elements of a tag. A format can be specified, with $item indicating the element, e.g. multiple="Option: $item"
Separator between multiple selections. Only relevant if multiple is specified
textBeforeTable: Supported parameters: Syntax: %ENCODE{"string"}% ENCODE{"string"} -- encodes a string Related: DISPLAYTIME, GMTIME, SERVERTIME Example: %DISPLAYTIME{"$hou:$min"}% expands to 20:10 Syntax: %DISPLAYTIME{"format"}% Formatted time - either GMT or Local server time, depending on setting in TWiki.cfg. Same format qualifiers as %GMTIME% DISPLAYTIME{"format"} -- formatted display time Related: DISPLAYTIME{"format"}, GMTIME, SERVERTIME Expands to: 29 Jul 2015 - 20:10 Syntax: %DISPLAYTIME% DISPLAYTIME -- display time Related: BASETOPIC, INCLUDINGWEB, INCLUDE, WEB Syntax: %BASEWEB% The web name where the includes started, e.g. the web of the first topic of nested includes. Same as %WEB% in case there is no include. BASEWEB -- base web where an INCLUDE started Related: BASEWEB, INCLUDINGTOPIC, INCLUDE, TOPIC Syntax: %BASETOPIC% The name of the topic where a single or nested INCLUDE started - same as %TOPIC% if there is no INCLUDE BASETOPIC -- base topic where an INCLUDE started Related: ATTACHURL, PUBURL,
textAfterTable: required topic="..." Topic where form data is located. May be of the form Web.TopicName Current topic format="..." Format string. $value expands to the field value "$value" default="..." Text shown when no value is defined for the field "" alttext="..." Text shown when field is not found in the form "" Example: %FORMFIELD{"ProjectName" topic="Projects.SushiProject" default="(not set)" alttext="ProjectName field found"}% Related: SEARCH GMTIME -- GM time Syntax: %GMTIME% Expands to: 29 Jul 2015 - 20:10 Related: DISPLAYTIME, GMTIME{"format"}, SERVERTIME GMTIME{"format"} -- formatted GM time Syntax: %GMTIME{"format"}% Supported variables: Variable: Unit: Example $seconds seconds 59 $minutes minutes 59 $hours
